summary: This is an email chain from March 24, 2019, discussing progress in the Epstein investigation by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. It details recent witness interviews, coordination with victims' attorneys, and efforts to secure an interview with a key witness, likely Virginia Giuffre, through her attorney Robbie Kaplan.

persons.name: Robbie Kaplan
persons.context: Attorney for a key witness (likely Virginia Giuffre) with whom investigators are negotiating an interview, discussing concerns about the witness's exposure.

events.title: Witness Interviews in Fort Lauderdale
events.description: Investigators interviewed two witnesses at the BSF office in Fort Lauderdale. A third witness declined to participate at the last minute.

events.title: Coordination with Victims' Attorney
events.description: Investigators had a call with an attorney who represented Florida victims a decade ago to schedule follow-up interviews with witnesses concerned about their prior civil case.

events.title: Negotiations for Key Witness Interview
events.description: Following a call with Robbie Kaplan, investigators are making progress toward an interview with a key witness, discussing concerns about exposure and planning an attorney proffer as a next step.

locations: BSF office in Fort Lauderdale, Florida
keyFacts: Investigators from the SDNY Public Corruption Unit were actively interviewing witnesses in Fort Lauderdale in March 2019.
A key witness, represented by attorney Robbie Kaplan, was hesitant to be interviewed due to concerns about 'exposure,' leading to negotiations for an attorney proffer.
Investigators coordinated with a prior attorney for Florida victims to access witnesses from the earlier civil case.
The document shows the ongoing investigative efforts by federal prosecutors years after Epstein's initial legal troubles.
